channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: History Today: When Akihito became the emperor of Japan
FirstUp: Blue Origin to launch New Glenn rocket, funeral of Jane Goodall... The news of the day
Bihar exit polls 2025: NDA's clean sweep, Mahagathbandhan to shrink. The big takeaways
Delhi car blast: Is it safe to travel to India's Capital?
Can Nato's tiny new missile be used against Russian drone incursions in Europe?
Quicksplained: Who is Dr Shaheen Shahid, the Lucknow doctor under NIA lens for role in Delhi blast case?
How Nyoma airfield in Ladakh marks a military aviation milestone for India
item.description: Nyoma offered the best bowl in the hills for building the airfield for fighter operations, adding a major airhead that greatly reduces reaction time

item.title: Rare earths are a strategic resource for 21st century: India must capitalise on its potential
item.description: While a fully diversified global market for rare earth minerals remains a long-term goal, the next decade will see significant state-backed investment in alternative supply chains, ensuring rare earths remain at the forefront of international relations and security policy

item.title: India’s Bahubali moment: Building space power for next-gen warfare
item.description: India is building formidable military space infrastructure, recognising that the next major conflict may well be decided not on terrestrial battlefields, but in space

item.title: Pakistan’s cosiness with US, China and Turkey aims to counter India in Indian Ocean
item.description: It needs to be watched how Islamabad carries not just two but three allies—China, Turkey and the US—and plays one against the other two for its own benefit

item.title: India’s exit from Ayni base in Tajikistan reflects a reorientation of its strategic choices
item.description: India’s withdrawal from Ayni, which started in 2022, will likely re-energise its pursuit of new military facilities in the Indian Ocean—the next arena of strategic contest and competition

item.title: Small in size, big in tech and influence: How Taiwan punches above its weight in Apec
item.description: In a region facing structural shifts—digital transformation, green transition, supply-chain re-engineering—Taiwan’s quiet but strategic engagement via Apec offers lessons in how mid-sized economies can exert influence, build partnerships and contribute to regional public goods
